name: Create Webhook
description: Create a new webhook. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission. Returns a [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) object on success. Webhook names follow our naming restrictions that can be found in our [Usernames and Nicknames](#DOCS_RESOURCES_USER/usernames-and-nicknames) documentation, with the following additional stipulations:

params.name: name
params.description: name of the webhook (1-80 characters)

params.name: avatar
params.description: image for the default webhook avatar

name: Get Channel Webhooks
description: Returns a list of channel [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) objects. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission.

name: Get Guild Webhooks
description: Returns a list of guild [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) objects. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission.

name: Get Webhook
description: Returns the new [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) object for the given id.

name: Get Webhook with Token
description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication and returns no user in the webhook object.

name: Modify Webhook
description: Modify a webhook. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission. Returns the updated [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) object on success.

params.name: name
params.description: the default name of the webhook

params.name: avatar
params.description: image for the default webhook avatar

params.name: channel_id
params.description: the new channel id this webhook should be moved to

name: Modify Webhook with Token
description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication, does not accept a `channel_id` parameter in the body, and does not return a user in the webhook object.

name: Delete Webhook
description: Delete a webhook permanently. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission. Returns a `204 No Content` response on success.

name: Delete Webhook with Token
description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication.

name: Execute Webhook
description: Refer to [Uploading Files](#DOCS_REFERENCE/uploading-files) for details on attachments and `multipart/form-data` requests.

query.name: wait
query.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response, and returns the created message body (defaults to `false`; when `false` a message that is not saved does not return an error)

query.name: thread_id
query.description: Send a message to the specified thread within a webhook's channel. The thread will automatically be unarchived.

params.name: content
params.description: the message contents (up to 2000 characters)

params.name: username
params.description: override the default username of the webhook

params.name: avatar_url
params.description: override the default avatar of the webhook

params.name: tts
params.description: true if this is a TTS message

params.name: embeds
params.description: embedded `rich` content

params.name: allowed_mentions
params.description: allowed mentions for the message

params.name: components
params.description: the components to include with the message

params.name: files[n]
params.description: the contents of the file being sent

params.name: payload_json
params.description: JSON encoded body of non-file params

params.name: attachments
params.description: attachment objects with filename and description

params.name: flags
params.description: [message flags](#DOCS_RESOURCES_CHANNEL/message-object-message-flags) combined as a [bitfield](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bit_field) (only `SUPPRESS_EMBEDS` can be set)

name: Execute Slack-Compatible Webhook
description: Refer to [Slack's documentation](https://api.slack.com/incoming-webhooks) for more information. We do not support Slack's `channel`, `icon_emoji`, `mrkdwn`, or `mrkdwn_in` properties.

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread to send the message in

query.name: wait
query.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response (defaults to `true`; when `false` a message that is not saved does not return an error)

name: Execute GitHub-Compatible Webhook
description: Add a new webhook to your GitHub repo (in the repo's settings), and use this endpoint as the "Payload URL." You can choose what events your Discord channel receives by choosing the "Let me select individual events" option and selecting individual events for the new webhook you're configuring.

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread to send the message in

query.name: wait
query.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response (defaults to `true`; when `false` a message that is not saved does not return an error)

name: Get Webhook Message
description: Returns a previously-sent webhook message from the same token. Returns a [message](#DOCS_RESOURCES_CHANNEL/message-object) object on success.

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread the message is in

name: Edit Webhook Message
description: Edits a previously-sent webhook message from the same token. Returns a [message](#DOCS_RESOURCES_CHANNEL/message-object) object on success.

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread the message is in

params.name: content
params.description: the message contents (up to 2000 characters)

params.name: embeds
params.description: embedded `rich` content

params.name: allowed_mentions
params.description: allowed mentions for the message

params.name: components
params.description: the components to include with the message

params.name: files[n]
params.description: the contents of the file being sent/edited

params.name: payload_json
params.description: JSON encoded body of non-file params (multipart/form-data only)

params.name: attachments
params.description: attached files to keep and possible descriptions for new files

name: Delete Webhook Message
description: Deletes a message that was created by the webhook. Returns a `204 No Content` response on success.

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread the message is in
